titleproper.value: Guide to the Allison Wolfe Riot Grrrl Collection <num>MSS.302</num>

author.value: Collection processed by Jennifer E. Neal

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2018-08-27T18:25:53</date>

extent.value: in 1 oversize flat box and 1 shoe box

abstract.value: Allison Wolfe (b. 1969), a songwriter and arts journalist, co-founded the third wave feminist punk movement, Riot Grrrl, and the feminist punk fanzine, "Girl Germs." She sang in several bands throughout the 1990s and 2000s including Bratmobile and Cold Cold Hearts, and organized Ladyfest, a non-profit feminist music festival, in 1999. Materials in this collection include two dresses, three "performance slips," and one pair of shoes.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Allison Wolfe Riot Grrrl Collection; MSS 302; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University.
Donated by Allison Wolfe in 2010. The accession number associated with this gift is 2010.302.

This collection consists of two dresses, three "performance slips," and one pair of shoes. Wolfe wore the slips during the 1990s while performing with the band, Bratmobile. The dresses and shoes are consistent with the style of clothing women wore in the 1990s and early 2000s, which is associated with the third wave feminist punk movement.
